In the digital age where tools define the craftsman, my software ecosystem reflects my research journey, workflow preferences, and commitment to reproducible, high-quality work. This page presents a carefully curated suite of tools that empower my research in machine learning, academic writing, data analysis, content creation, and automation.

## Machine Learning & AI Development

My machine learning workflow is built on reliable frameworks, configuration tools, and interactive environments that support both rapid experimentation and long-running research projects.

### Deep Learning Frameworks

- [**PyTorch**](https://pytorch.org/) — Primary deep learning library for building and training neural networks.
- [**TensorFlow**](https://www.tensorflow.org/) — Alternative ML framework for selected projects and comparisons.
- [**PyTorch Lightning**](https://lightning.ai/docs/pytorch/stable/) — High-level training framework for clean, modular, and scalable experiments.
- [**Hugging Face Transformers**](https://huggingface.co/transformers/) — Library for state-of-the-art transformer-based NLP models.

### Python Ecosystem

- [**Python 3.x**](https://www.python.org/) — Core programming language for ML, automation, and scripting.
- [**Jupyter Notebook**](https://jupyter.org/) — Interactive environment for experimentation and visual debugging.
- [**Google Colab**](https://colab.research.google.com/) — GPU-enabled cloud notebooks for resource-intensive experiments.

### Configuration & Versioning

- [**Hydra**](https://hydra.cc/) — Flexible configuration system for structured experiment management.
- [**Data Version Control (DVC)**](https://dvc.org/) — Version control for datasets, models, and ML pipelines.
- [**TensorBoard**](https://www.tensorflow.org/tensorboard) — Visualization of learning curves, metrics, and model graphs.

## Development Environment

A productive development environment is essential for maintaining clean code, reproducible projects, and smooth cross-platform workflows.

### Code Editors & IDEs

- [**Visual Studio Code (VS Code)**](https://code.visualstudio.com/) — Primary IDE for Python, R, Quarto, and web development.
- [**RStudio**](https://posit.co/products/open-source/rstudio/) — Integrated development environment for R and R Markdown.
- [**Doom Emacs**](https://github.com/doomemacs/doomemacs/) — Highly customizable text editing environment for advanced workflows.
- [**Notepad++**](https://notepad-plus-plus.org/) — Lightweight editor for quick edits on Windows.

### Environment Management

- [**Conda**](https://docs.conda.io/) / [**Micromamba**](https://mamba.readthedocs.io/) — Environment and package management for data science and ML.
- [**Lightning-Hydra Template**](https://github.com/ashleve/lightning-hydra-template) — Opinionated ML project template combining PyTorch Lightning, Hydra, and best practices.

### Terminal & Shell

- [**Windows Terminal**](https://learn.microsoft.com/windows/terminal/) — Modern and customizable terminal host on Windows.
- [**PowerShell**](https://learn.microsoft.com/powershell/) — Scripting and automation shell for system tasks.
- [**WSL2 (Ubuntu)**](https://learn.microsoft.com/windows/wsl/) — Full Linux environment inside Windows for development and HPC access.

## Research & Academic Writing

Research productivity depends on well-integrated tools for literature management, document preparation, and long-form writing across thesis work, articles, and talks.

### Literature Management

- [**Zotero**](https://www.zotero.org/) + [**BetterBibTeX**](https://retorque.re/zotero-better-bibtex/) — Reference management with stable citation keys for LaTeX and Quarto.
- [**Google Scholar**](https://scholar.google.com/) — Literature search and citation tracking.
- [**ORCID**](https://orcid.org/) / [**Scopus**](https://www.scopus.com/) / [**ResearchGate**](https://www.researchgate.net/) — Academic identity and publication profiles.

### Document Preparation

- [**Quarto**](https://quarto.org/) — Primary tool for reproducible reports, presentations, and thesis chapters.
- [**LaTeX**](https://www.latex-project.org/) — Typesetting engine for professional-quality academic documents.
- [**Pandoc**](https://pandoc.org/) — Document conversion backbone integrated with Quarto and R Markdown.
- **Markdown** — Lightweight markup language for everyday writing.
- [**TinyTeX**](https://yihui.org/tinytex/) — Minimal TeX distribution optimized for Quarto and R Markdown workflows.

### Writing Tools

- [**VS Code**](https://code.visualstudio.com/) — Central editor for Quarto, Markdown, and LaTeX content.
- [**Obsidian**](https://obsidian.md/) — Knowledge management system for research notes and ideas.

### Diagramming & Graphics

- [**TikZ/PGF**](https://ctan.org/pkg/pgf) — LaTeX-based diagrams for publication-quality figures.
- [**Mermaid.js**](https://mermaid.js.org/) — Text-based diagrams embedded within Markdown and Quarto documents.
- [**Draw.io (diagrams.net)**](https://www.diagrams.net/) — Browser-based diagramming for flowcharts and conceptual diagrams.
- [**Inkscape**](https://inkscape.org/) — Vector graphics editor for technical illustrations and figures.

## Statistical Computing with R

R plays a key role in my workflow for statistical analysis, reproducible reports, and structured automation around CVs and literature reviews.

### Core R Tools

- [**R**](https://www.r-project.org/) — Language and environment for statistical computing and graphics.
- [**tidyverse**](https://www.tidyverse.org/) — Collection of packages for data manipulation and visualization.
- [**rmarkdown**](https://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/) — Dynamic documents combining code, output, and narrative.
- [**pagedown**](https://github.com/rstudio/pagedown) — HTML-based paged documents, including academic CVs.

### Use Cases

- Automation for systematic literature review (SLR) tables and summaries.
- CV generation via an Excel → R → pagedown pipeline.
- Statistical analysis, exploratory data analysis, and visualization.

## Data Visualization & Graphics

Effective visualization is essential for interpreting models, communicating results, and producing publication-ready figures.

### Data Visualization

- [**Matplotlib**](https://matplotlib.org/) — Foundation for static and custom plots in Python.
- [**Seaborn**](https://seaborn.pydata.org/) — High-level interface for statistical graphics in Python.
- [**ggplot2**](https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/) — Grammar of graphics for expressive plots in R.
- [**Plotly**](https://plotly.com/) — Interactive plots and dashboards in Python and R.
- [**Tableau**](https://www.tableau.com/) — Visual analytics and business intelligence dashboards.

### Image & Design Tools

- [**GIMP**](https://www.gimp.org/) — Open-source raster graphics editor for image editing.
- [**LibreOffice Draw**](https://www.libreoffice.org/discover/draw/) — Quick diagrams and illustrations.
- [**Microsoft PowerPoint**](https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/powerpoint) — Slides and visual content creation for teaching and talks.

## High-Performance Computing

For large-scale experiments and model training, I rely on HPC clusters and monitoring tools to manage and track compute usage.

### Cluster Computing

- **PBS Job Scheduler** — Submitting and managing batch jobs on HPC clusters using commands such as `qsub` and `qstat`.
- **SSH / SCP** — Secure remote access and file transfer to and from servers and clusters.

### Monitoring Tools

- `htop` — Real-time system and process monitoring in the terminal.
- `nvidia-smi` — GPU monitoring and diagnostics for NVIDIA devices.

## Version Control & DevOps

Version control, collaboration, and automation are central to maintaining clean, reproducible research codebases and websites.

### Version Control & CI/CD

- [**Git**](https://git-scm.com/) — Distributed version control system used across all projects.
- [**GitHub**](https://github.com/) — Code hosting, issue tracking, and collaboration platform.
- [**GitHub Actions**](https://github.com/features/actions) — CI/CD pipelines for testing, building, and deploying (including Quarto websites).
- [**Data Version Control (DVC)**](https://dvc.org/) — Versioning for datasets, trained models, and experiment pipelines.

## Productivity & System Management

Good tooling for system management and productivity helps keep environments consistent and workflows efficient across machines.

### System Management

- [**Windows Package Manager (winget)**](https://learn.microsoft.com/windows/package-manager/) — Command-line installation and update of Windows software.
- [**chezmoi**](https://www.chezmoi.io/) — Dotfile management for synchronizing configuration across systems.

### Productivity Tools

- [**Raindrop.io**](https://raindrop.io/) — Bookmark and resource management for web content and references.
- [**Microsoft Edge**](https://www.microsoft.com/edge) — Primary web browser.
- [**Espanso**](https://espanso.org/) — Text expansion to speed up repetitive typing.
- [**Slack**](https://slack.com/) / [**Microsoft Teams**](https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-teams) — Communication platforms for academic and collaborative work.

### Cloud Storage

- [**Google Drive**](https://www.google.com/drive/) — Cloud storage for backup, collaboration, and syncing across devices.

## Content Creation & Outreach

Content creation is an important part of sharing research, teaching concepts, and building outreach through platforms like YouTube.

### Video Production

- [**OBS Studio**](https://obsproject.com/) — Screen recording and live streaming for tutorials and talks.
- [**Shotcut**](https://shotcut.org/) — Open-source video editor for assembling and editing recordings.
- [**YouTube Studio**](https://studio.youtube.com/) — Channel and content management for my *ResearchInfuser* YouTube channel.

## Office Suites

A combination of open-source and proprietary office tools supports teaching, documentation, and administrative work.

### Office Productivity

- [**LibreOffice Suite**](https://www.libreoffice.org/) — Open-source office suite for documents, spreadsheets, and presentations.
- [**Microsoft Office Suite**](https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365) — Word, Excel, and PowerPoint when institutionally required.

## Automation & Scripting

Automation reduces repetitive work and keeps my workflows consistent, especially for documents, timetables, and websites.

### Automation & Web Scripting

- [**Google Apps Script**](https://developers.google.com/apps-script) — Automation for Google Workspace, including timetable generation and form processing.
- **Excel → R → pagedown pipeline** — Automated generation of a structured academic CV from tabular data.
- **HTML / CSS / JavaScript** — Web content customization, small utilities, and UI enhancements.
